headline: Verizon Buyback And Fiber Deal Reframe Growth And Cash Return Story
summary: Verizon Communications (NYSE:VZ) announced a new $25b share repurchase program. The company completed its acquisition of Frontier's fiber assets, expanding its fiber footprint. Verizon reported its highest net subscriber additions since 2019. Management outlined a transformation plan focused on efficiency, cost reductions, and capital returns. Verizon Communications, trading at $44.52, is placing fresh attention on capital return with a large buyback that accompanies a multiyear...

headline: Insider Trading Fears Surface As Super Bowl Ad Prediction Market Grows
summary: In the lead up to Super Bowl 60, prediction market platforms have started offering contracts on which companies will run ads during the game. This new development has sparked concerns about the potential for insider trading. Prediction market platforms, Kalshi and Polymarket, have initiated contracts on which companies will advertise during Super Bowl 60, set to take place on Feb. 8 in Santa Clara, California. Users have the opportunity to trade on whether Salesforce (NYSE:CRM), Verizon (NYSE:VZ

headline: Charter Revamps Network And Mobile Partnerships As Board Refresh Shapes Outlook
summary: Charter Communications is rolling out WiFi 7 Extenders and planning multi-gigabit speeds across its footprint by 2027. The company is expanding rural broadband with a substantial buildout expected to be completed in 2026. Charter has updated its mobile virtual network operator deals with Verizon and T-Mobile to support its growing mobile business. Wade Davis has been appointed to the Board of Directors, adding fresh input at the governance level. Charter Communications (NasdaqGS: CHTR) is...

headline: Verizon says right-sizing the organization, saving on OpEx
summary: Says “just the beginning of the efficiencies we are uncovering.” Says reducing complexity and removing pain points. Says examining every dollar of OpEx and CapEx. Says bar will be high for investments. Says still in “early stages” of transformation. Says will not rely on “empty price increases” to drive short term revenue and earnings. Says MVNO agreement with Charter and Comcast is an “accretive deal.” Says 2026 guidance reflects the beginning of the company’s turnaround. Comments taken from Q4

headline: Amazon’s layoffs are staggering. We’ve seen this before
summary: Big Tech continues to wrestle with mass layoffs, most recently with Amazon’s announcement of 16,000 job cuts. It’s a trend that started long before the AI race: organizational change brought by the arrival of new technology.

headline: Verizon (VZ) Surges 11.8% as Earnings, Outlook Impress
